section.section:
The General Assembly finds that:
a child is not capable of self-protection; and
if care of a child is given over to another, mental and physical risks arise that need to be offset by reasonable protective measures.

The General Assembly also finds that:
there is a shortage of child care placements for children under the age of 2 years; and
the rules and regulations adopted under this subtitle should provide for small child care centers that provide care in a homelike environment.

text.section:
The purpose of this subtitle is not to limit a parent in getting the help of responsible relatives or friends in giving child care for a child, but is to aid each parent and protect each child from the risk present if:
the child is cared for by an individual other than a relative or friend; and
children of more than one family are cared for together or, on different days, use the same facilities.
